name: Jollof Rice
instructions: 1. Wash the rice thoroughly and set aside. 2. Blend tomatoes, onions, and bell peppers to make a smooth paste. 3. Heat oil in a pot and add the blended paste, cooking it until it reduces and thickens. 4. Add the chicken stock and spices, then mix well. 5. Add the rice to the pot and stir until well-coated with the sauce. 6. Cover and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, until the rice is tender and fully cooked.

name: Egusi Soup
instructions: 1. Blend egusi seeds into a fine powder. 2. Heat palm oil in a pot and sauté onions until translucent. 3. Add the blended egusi and stir constantly to prevent burning. 4. Gradually add water or stock to the mixture, stirring continuously to achieve a smooth consistency. 5. Add spinach and seasoning cubes, then simmer until the soup thickens and the flavors meld together. 6. Serve hot with pounded yam or fufu.

name: Suya
instructions: 1. Cut the beef into thin strips and season with suya spice mix. 2. Thread the seasoned beef onto skewers. 3. Grill the skewers over medium heat, turning occasionally until the meat is cooked through and slightly charred. 4. Slice onions and peppers and serve alongside the grilled meat. 5. Enjoy the suya with a side of spicy pepper sauce or a fresh salad.

name: Pounded Yam and Egusi Soup
instructions: 1. Peel and cut the yam into chunks and boil until tender. 2. While the yam is cooking, blend egusi seeds into a fine powder. 3. Heat palm oil in a pot and sauté onions until translucent. 4. Add the blended egusi to the pot, stirring constantly. 5. Gradually add water or stock, stirring until the soup thickens. 6. Add spinach and cook until tender. 7. To prepare the pounded yam, mash the cooked yam until smooth and stretchy. 8. Serve the pounded yam with the egusi soup on the side.

name: Moi Moi
instructions: 1. Soak the beans and peel off the skins. 2. Blend the beans with onions and red pepper to make a smooth paste. 3. Add palm oil and seasoning cubes to the paste and mix well. 4. Pour the mixture into a pot or steamable containers. 5. Steam for about 45 minutes or until set. 6. Serve with rice or enjoy as a standalone meal.

name: Akara
instructions: 1. Soak the beans and remove the skins. 2. Blend the beans with onions and pepper into a smooth paste. 3. Heat oil in a deep pan. 4. Spoon the bean mixture into the hot oil, forming small balls. 5. Fry until golden brown and crispy. 6. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

name: Bitterleaf Soup
instructions: 1. Wash the bitterleaf thoroughly to reduce its bitterness. 2. Cook meat and stockfish until tender. 3. Add palm oil and seasoning cubes to the pot. 4. Add the bitterleaf and simmer until well combined. 5. Adjust seasoning as needed. 6. Serve hot with pounded yam or fufu.

name: Pepper Soup
instructions: 1. Cut goat meat into chunks and boil until tender. 2. Add pepper soup spice and onions to the pot. 3. Simmer for about 20 minutes. 4. Add seasoning cubes and scent leaves. 5. Cook for an additional 10 minutes. 6. Serve hot as a comforting soup or starter.

name: Nkwobi
instructions: 1. Boil cow foot and cow leg until tender. 2. Cut into bite-sized pieces. 3. Prepare a mixture of palm oil and potash. 4. Add the meat pieces to the mixture and stir. 5. Add seasoning cubes and mix well. 6. Serve hot, garnished with sliced onions and chopped vegetables.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 2 hours. 2. Grill or bake the chicken until cooked through. 3. In a pan, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden. 4. Add tomatoes and spices, and cook until thickened. 5. Stir in grilled chicken and cook until heated through. 6. Serve with rice or naan.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: 1. Sauté onions, garlic, and spices in butter until fragrant. 2. Add tomatoes and cook until softened. 3. Stir in cream and cook until the sauce is thick. 4. Add paneer and cook until heated through. 5. Serve with rice or naan.

name: Chana Masala
instructions: 1. Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden. 2. Add spices and cook for a few minutes. 3. Stir in tomatoes and cook until thickened. 4. Add chickpeas and simmer until heated through. 5. Serve with rice or roti.

name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: 1. Sauté onions and spices in oil until fragrant. 2. Add potatoes and cauliflower, and cook until tender. 3. Stir in tomatoes and cook until the mixture is dry. 4. Serve with rice or roti.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices. 2. Grill or bake until cooked through. 3. Sauté onions, garlic, and spices in butter. 4. Add tomatoes and cream, and cook until thickened. 5. Stir in chicken and simmer. 6. Serve with rice or naan.

name: Palak Paneer
instructions: 1. Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger. 2. Add spinach and cook until wilted. 3. Puree the spinach mixture and return to the pan. 4. Stir in paneer and spices, and cook until heated through. 5. Serve with rice or naan.

name: Samosas
instructions: 1. Cook and mash potatoes. 2. Stir-fry peas with spices, then mix with mashed potatoes. 3. Place filling in samosa wrappers and fold. 4. Fry until golden brown. 5. Serve with chutney.

name: Dal Tadka
instructions: 1. Cook lentils until tender. 2. Sauté onions, garlic, and spices. 3. Add tomatoes and cook until thickened. 4. Stir in lentils and cook for a few minutes. 5. Serve with rice or roti.

name: Raita
instructions: 1. Grate cucumber and mix with yogurt. 2. Add cumin, cilantro, and salt. 3. Chill before serving.

name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: 1. Prepare dough from whole wheat flour. 2. Make a spiced potato filling. 3. Roll out dough, place filling in the center, and seal. 4. Roll out again and cook on a griddle with some oil. 5. Serve hot with yogurt or pickle.

name: Coq au Vin
instructions: 1. Sauté bacon until crisp. 2. Brown chicken in bacon fat. 3. Remove chicken and add onions, carrots, and garlic. 4. Deglaze with wine and return chicken to the pot. 5. Add mushrooms and simmer until chicken is tender. 6. Serve with potatoes or crusty bread.

name: Bouillabaisse
instructions: 1. Sauté onions and garlic, then add tomatoes and herbs. 2. Add fish stock and bring to a simmer. 3. Add fish and shellfish, and cook until done. 4. Serve with rouille and crusty bread.

name: Ratatouille
instructions: 1. Sauté onions and garlic, then add bell peppers, zucchini, and eggplant. 2. Add tomatoes and herbs, and cook until vegetables are tender. 3. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Quiche Lorraine
instructions: 1. Cook bacon and onions. 2. Whisk together eggs and cream. 3. Place bacon, onions, and cheese in pie crust. 4. Pour egg mixture over the top and bake until set. 5. Serve warm or cold.

name: Crêpes Suzette
instructions: 1. Prepare crêpe batter and cook crêpes in a hot pan. 2. Prepare sauce by melting butter and adding orange juice, zest, and liqueur. 3. Fold crêpes into quarters and cook in the sauce. 4. Serve with extra sauce.

name: Beef Bourguignon
instructions: 1. Brown beef and bacon, then remove. 2. Sauté onions, garlic, and carrots. 3. Return beef to the pot, add wine and broth, and simmer. 4. Add mushrooms and cook until beef is tender. 5. Serve with potatoes or bread.

name: French Onion Soup
instructions: 1. Caramelize onions in butter. 2. Add beef broth and herbs, and simmer. 3. Top with bread and cheese, and broil until cheese is melted. 4. Serve hot.

name: Salmon en Papillote
instructions: 1. Place salmon and vegetables on parchment paper. 2. Top with lemon slices and herbs. 3. Fold paper to create a packet and bake. 4. Serve in the parchment with a side of rice.

name: Duck Confit
instructions: 1. Rub duck legs with salt and let cure overnight. 2. Rinse and cook in duck fat with garlic and thyme until tender. 3. Crisp skin under broiler before serving. 4. Serve with potatoes or vegetables.

name: Tarte Tatin
instructions: 1. Caramelize sugar and butter in a pan. 2. Arrange apple slices on top and cook until tender. 3. Cover with pie crust and bake. 4. Flip to serve.

name: Escargots de Bourgogne
instructions: 1. Prepare escargots with garlic butter and parsley. 2. Place in shells or a baking dish. 3. Top with breadcrumbs and bake until golden. 4. Serve hot.

name: Tacos al Pastor
instructions: 1. Marinate pork with spices and pineapple. 2. Grill or roast pork until cooked. 3. Slice thinly and serve on tortillas with onions, cilantro, and lime.

name: Enchiladas
instructions: 1. Fill tortillas with chicken and cheese. 2. Roll up and place in a baking dish. 3. Cover with enchilada sauce and cheese. 4. Bake until bubbly and serve with rice and beans.

name: Guacamole
instructions: 1. Mash avocados and mix with lime juice, cilantro, tomatoes, and onions. 2. Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for other dishes.

name: Chiles en Nogada
instructions: 1. Roast and peel poblanos. 2. Prepare a filling with ground meat and fruit. 3. Stuff peppers with the filling. 4. Top with a walnut cream sauce and serve.

name: Tamales
instructions: 1. Prepare masa dough and filling. 2. Spread masa on corn husks, add filling, and fold. 3. Steam until cooked. 4. Serve with salsa or crema.

name: Pozole
instructions: 1. Cook pork with garlic and onions. 2. Add hominy and chili peppers, and simmer until tender. 3. Serve with toppings like radishes, cabbage, and lime.

name: Quesadillas
instructions: 1. Place cheese and any additional fillings between tortillas. 2. Cook on a griddle until cheese is melted and tortillas are crispy. 3. Serve with salsa or guacamole.

name: Carnitas
instructions: 1. Season pork shoulder and cook with spices and orange juice until tender. 2. Shred pork and crisp under broiler. 3. Serve with tortillas and toppings.

name: Sopes
instructions: 1. Shape corn dough into thick discs and cook. 2. Top with beans, meat, lettuce, cheese, and salsa. 3. Serve immediately.

name: Mexican Street Corn
instructions: 1. Grill corn until charred. 2. Brush with mayonnaise and sprinkle with cheese, lime juice, and chili powder. 3. Serve hot.

name: Bibimbap
instructions: 1. Cook rice and prepare vegetables. 2. Sauté vegetables and egg separately. 3. Assemble rice, vegetables, and egg in a bowl. 4. Top with gochujang and sesame oil. 5. Mix before eating.

name: Kimchi
instructions: 1. Prepare cabbage and radish and mix with salt. 2. Make a paste with gochugaru, garlic, ginger, and fish sauce. 3. Combine with vegetables and pack into jars. 4. Let ferment at room temperature for 1-2 days before refrigerating.

name: Bulgogi
instructions: 1. Marinate beef with soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and sesame oil. 2. Cook beef in a hot pan until browned. 3. Serve with rice and green onions.

name: Kimchi Jjigae
instructions: 1. Sauté pork and garlic. 2. Add kimchi, tofu, and onions, and simmer. 3. Serve with rice and green onions.

name: Samgyeopsal
instructions: 1. Grill pork belly slices until crispy. 2. Serve with lettuce, ssamjang, and sliced garlic. 3. Wrap pork in lettuce and enjoy.

name: Japchae
instructions: 1. Cook noodles and vegetables separately. 2. Stir-fry vegetables with soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and sesame oil. 3. Mix noodles and vegetables together. 4. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Tteokbokki
instructions: 1. Cook rice cakes in water. 2. Prepare a sauce with gochujang, sugar, and soy sauce. 3. Add sauce to rice cakes and simmer. 4. Garnish with green onions before serving.

name: Kimchi Fried Rice
instructions: 1. Sauté kimchi and garlic. 2. Add rice and soy sauce, and stir-fry. 3. Top with a fried egg and green onions. 4. Serve warm.

name: Korean BBQ
instructions: 1. Marinate beef with soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and sesame oil. 2. Grill beef until cooked through. 3. Serve with rice and green onions.
